result.execSummary:
The defendant Michel L Wortman Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
With huber and consecutive to any other sentence.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michel L Wortman Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Warrant was received and destroyed
Warrant was canceled.  Talked to Sam at GLSO.
sent to GLSO July 28, 2017

1:24 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Wesley Kottke.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with no no repeater and probation.  ADA concurs.  Atty Wesley Kottke concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 striking the repeater.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Statement by defendant's girlfriend.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Kottke.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS: 

-30 days county jail.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-Court costs.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.
-No Contact with the victim.(forms)
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

Court grants 3 days of sentence credit.

Court orders the defendant to pay the monies on 2016CM16 as a condition of probation but not to be collected by probation.

Court adjourned at 1:35 p.m.

2:38 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  FTP $293.00 on 2016CM16.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by defendant - was incarcerated in Dodge County and has been looking for a job.  Court questions defendant regarding address.  Statement by defendant - address is:  N1393 H /FF Dalton, WI.

Court questions DA regarding notice of hearing.  Statement by DA.  Further statement by Mitzi from the DA's office.  DA requests a cash bond and same conditions as before.  Court orders $250.00 cash bond and same conditions as before.

Court orders defendant to appear in court on December 20, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:43 p.m.

Warrant was canceled.  Talked to Dave at GLSO.
Defendant in custody and present via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.

2:36 pm 
Defendant Michel L Wortman appeared by video means and without counsel. 
Defendant makes statement regarding turning himself in upon notice of the Warrant and requests to set up payment plan.
Court questions Defendant as to what he can afford to pay. 
Defendant makes statement that he is employed at Baumann Meats by Marquette.
Court orders Defendant to pay $75 per month, with the first payment in the amount of $75 due on or before Friday, August 19, 2016, and continuing the 19th of each month, thereafter, until paid in full.
Defendant provides new address of 555 Happy Hollow Rd, Fall River WI but did not know the zip code.
Court quashes Warrant, stayed pending compliance with payment plan.
Court adjourned at 2:40 pm
sent to GLSO on August 2, 2016
from Clerk to Defendant re: Warrant

1:11 pm
No Appearance by Defendant.  Court orders Warrant.
Court adjourned 1:11 pm
FTP Hearing 07-25-2016 for $443.00

9:29 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will not be getting an attorney.  DA recites offer - upon plea to the charge will recommend jail.  Statement  by defendant - will accept offer.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty and strikes the repeater.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-20 days county jail, with huber and out of county service & out of county travel.  Consecutive to any other sentence.
-Court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:40 a.m.

No Contact with Troy M and his residence.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant may go to the residence of the victim to obtain his/her personal property, but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer.
Status hearing at 03-08-2016 09:15 am

No Contact with Troy M and his residence.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant may go to the residence of the victim to obtain his/her personal property, but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer.

8:50 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Defendant now confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  Court questions defendant regarding address and employment.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Troy M and his residence.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant may go to the residence of the victim to obtain his/her personal property, but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 8, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:55 a.m.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
